template:
# Test Plan Document - {{PROJECT_NAME}} v{{VERSION}}

## 1. Introduction

### Project Overview
This Test Plan document outlines the testing approach for {{PROJECT_NAME}} version {{VERSION}}.

### Purpose
The purpose of this Test Plan is to:
- Define the testing strategy and approach
- Identify testing resources and responsibilities
- Establish test schedules and milestones
- Document test cases and scenarios
- Define success criteria and risk mitigation

### Document Scope
This document covers all testing activities for the current release cycle.

## 2. Scope

Based on the requirements:
{{TEST_PLAN_REQUIREMENTS}}

### In Scope
The following areas will be tested:
- Functional Requirements
  - [Feature/Module 1]
  - [Feature/Module 2]
  - [Feature/Module 3]
- Non-Functional Requirements
  - Performance
  - Security
  - Usability
  - Compatibility

### Out of Scope
The following areas are excluded from this test cycle:
- [Excluded feature/component]
- [Third-party integrations not yet available]
- [Future release features]

### Test Deliverables
- Test Plan Document (this document)
- Test Cases and Test Scripts
- Test Execution Reports
- Defect Reports
- Test Summary Report

## 3. Test Strategy

### Testing Levels

#### Unit Testing
- **Objective**: Verify individual components work correctly
- **Approach**: Developer-driven, automated where possible
- **Coverage Target**: 80% code coverage
- **Tools**: [Testing framework]

#### Integration Testing
- **Objective**: Verify component interactions
- **Approach**: API testing, service integration
- **Focus Areas**: Data flow, interface contracts
- **Tools**: [Integration testing tools]

#### System Testing
- **Objective**: Verify end-to-end functionality
- **Approach**: Black-box testing based on requirements
- **Test Types**:
  - Functional Testing
  - Performance Testing
  - Security Testing
  - Usability Testing

#### Acceptance Testing
- **Objective**: Validate business requirements
- **Approach**: User-driven scenarios
- **Participants**: Business stakeholders, end users
- **Success Criteria**: All acceptance criteria met

### Testing Approach

#### Manual Testing
- Exploratory testing for new features
- User interface testing
- Usability testing
- Ad-hoc testing

#### Automated Testing
- Regression test suites
- API testing
- Performance testing
- Continuous integration tests

### Test Data Management
- Test data creation strategy
- Data privacy and security
- Test data refresh procedures
- Production data masking

## 5. Test Cases

### Test Case Template

| Field | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| Test Case ID | Unique identifier |
| Test Case Name | Descriptive name |
| Preconditions | Required setup |
| Test Steps | Detailed steps |
| Expected Results | Expected outcome |
| Actual Results | Actual outcome (filled during execution) |
| Status | Pass/Fail/Blocked |
| Priority | High/Medium/Low |
| Test Data | Required test data |

### Sample Test Cases

#### TC001: User Login - Valid Credentials
**Priority**: High  
**Preconditions**: User account exists in system  
**Test Steps**:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter valid username
3. Enter valid password
4. Click Login button

**Expected Results**: User successfully logged in and redirected to dashboard  
**Test Data**: username: testuser, password: Test@123

#### TC002: User Login - Invalid Credentials
**Priority**: High  
**Preconditions**: Login page accessible  
**Test Steps**:
1. Navigate to login page
2. Enter invalid username
3. Enter invalid password
4. Click Login button

**Expected Results**: Error message displayed, user remains on login page  
**Test Data**: username: invalid, password: wrong

### Test Case Categories

#### Functional Test Cases
- Authentication and Authorization
- Data Input and Validation
- Business Logic Verification
- Integration Points
- Error Handling

#### Non-Functional Test Cases
- Performance Test Scenarios
- Security Test Cases
- Usability Test Cases
- Compatibility Test Cases

## 7. Roles and Responsibilities

### Test Team Structure

| Role | Name | Responsibilities |
|------|------|------------------|
| Test Manager | [Name] | Test planning, coordination, reporting |
| Test Lead | [Name] | Test design, execution oversight |
| Test Engineer | [Name] | Test case creation and execution |
| Automation Engineer | [Name] | Test automation development |
| Performance Tester | [Name] | Performance testing execution |
| Business Analyst | [Name] | Requirements clarification |
| Developer | [Name] | Unit testing, defect resolution |

### RACI Matrix

| Activity | Test Manager | Test Lead | Test Engineer | Developer |
|----------|--------------|-----------|---------------|------------|
| Test Planning | R | A | C | I |
| Test Design | A | R | C | I |
| Test Execution | I | A | R | C |
| Defect Management | A | R | R | R |
| Test Reporting | R | A | C | I |

*R=Responsible, A=Accountable, C=Consulted, I=Informed*

## 8. Risk Analysis and Mitigation

### Risk Assessment

| Risk ID | Risk Description | Probability | Impact | Mitigation Strategy | Owner |
|---------|------------------|-------------|---------|---------------------|--------|
| R001 | Test environment instability | Medium | High | Maintain backup environment | Infrastructure Team |
| R002 | Insufficient test coverage | Low | High | Early test planning, automation | Test Lead |
| R003 | Resource unavailability | Medium | Medium | Cross-training, backup resources | Test Manager |
| R004 | Requirement changes | High | Medium | Agile approach, frequent communication | Business Analyst |
| R005 | Critical defects found late | Low | High | Early testing, shift-left approach | Test Team |
| R006 | Test data issues | Medium | Medium | Test data management strategy | Test Engineer |
| R007 | Third-party integration delays | Medium | High | Mock services, early integration | Development Team |

### Contingency Plans

#### High Priority Risks
- **Plan A**: Primary mitigation strategy
- **Plan B**: Backup approach if Plan A fails
- **Escalation**: Management intervention criteria

#### Medium Priority Risks
- Regular monitoring and status updates
- Proactive communication with stakeholders
- Resource reallocation as needed

## 9. Exit Criteria

### Test Completion Criteria

#### Mandatory Exit Criteria
- [ ] 100% of Critical test cases executed
- [ ] 95% of High priority test cases executed
- [ ] 90% of Medium priority test cases executed
- [ ] Zero Critical defects open
- [ ] Zero High severity defects open
- [ ] All Major defects have workarounds
- [ ] Test coverage meets minimum threshold (80%)
- [ ] Performance benchmarks achieved
- [ ] Security scan completed with no critical vulnerabilities

#### Optional Exit Criteria
- [ ] 80% of Low priority test cases executed
- [ ] Automation coverage > 60%
- [ ] User satisfaction score > 4.0/5.0

### Go/No-Go Decision Criteria

| Criterion | Threshold | Current Status | Decision |
|-----------|-----------|----------------|----------|
| Test Execution | >95% | [%] | [Go/No-Go] |
| Critical Defects | 0 | [Number] | [Go/No-Go] |
| High Defects | 0 | [Number] | [Go/No-Go] |
| Performance | Meet SLA | [Status] | [Go/No-Go] |
| Security | Pass scan | [Status] | [Go/No-Go] |

### Sign-off Process

1. Test Summary Report preparation
2. Stakeholder review meeting
3. Outstanding issues discussion
4. Risk acceptance documentation
5. Formal sign-off from:
   - Product Owner
   - Test Manager
   - Development Manager
   - Business Stakeholder
